required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Iodine Status Monitoring in PortUguese Pregnant woMen: Impact of Supplementation
clinical_study.official_title: Iodine Status Monitoring in PortUguese Pregnant woMen: Impact of Supplementation

collaborator.agency: Center for Health Technology and Services Research
Centro Hospitalar De São João, E.P.E.

brief_summary.textblock: Data from 2007 regarding iodine status among Portuguese pregnant women indicate this is an iodine deficient population group, with only 16.8% presenting adequate urinary iodine values. This may have serious implications for normal cognitive development of the offspring and a concerning socioeconomic impact. In 2013, concerns by the Portuguese Directorate-General of Health lead to the implementation of a public health policy (nº 011/2013) recommending iodine supplementation during pregnancy. IoMum emerges from this context to monitor and update iodine status in Portuguese pregnant women and to evaluate the effectiveness of the above policy by assessing clinical compliance to iodine supplementation and the impact of iodine supplementation in this vulnerable group. IoMum will update data on iodine nutrition in Portuguese pregnant women, promoting political actions towards the elimination of iodine deficiency and thus to the reduction of nutritional, social and economic inequalities.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 10 and 13 plus 6 days (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 1)
primary_outcome.description: Median urinary iodine concentration at 1st trimester of gestation

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of compliance to iodine supplementation guideline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 10 and 13 plus 6 days (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 1)
primary_outcome.description: Rate of compliance to iodine supplementation guideline at 1st trimester of gestation

secondary_outcome.description: Change in median iodine-to-creatinine ratio between 1st and 3rd trimesters of gestation

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of pregnant women with insufficient, adequate or excessive iodine intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 10 and 13 plus 6 days (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Classification of pregnant women by urinary iodine concentration levels according to WHO criteria (insufficient, adequate or excessive iodine intake) at 1st trimester of gestation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 35 and 41 (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal median thyroglobulin at 3rd trimester of gestation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 10 and 13 plus 6 days (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean sodium excretion at 1st trimester of gestation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between gestational weeks 35 and 41 (one timepoint collection - Timepoint 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean sodium excretion at 3rd trimester of gestation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women attending the 1st trimester fetal ultrasound scan, from the 10th to the 13th gestational week.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of Levothyroxine.

overall_official.affiliation: Center for Health Technology and Services Research
Center for Health Technology and Services Research

facility.name: Center for Health Technology and Services Research
